Posts.Content: As my GP said once, the trouble with rare illnesses is that there are so many of them. No GP can know much about even a fraction of them. However, with more people surving cancer for longer, one thing that is certain is that more of us will find ourselves with consequences of treatment, and so knowldge out there is increasing. On the more positive side of things, it seems that neurological consequnces of treatment that arise soon after treatement are more likely to improve and may even self-repair. The nervous system may not be all that easy to mend but, like road and railway networks, if it can find a workable way round a problem en-route, it will.
Posts.Title: Periphial Neuropathy after chemo treatment
